intro: Dionysia zetterlundii, commonly known as the Zetterlund's dionysia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of red and purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
